page.title: 03Local History-Martello Tower
page.content:
{The Martello Tower }
These were built to defend our shores against an earlier planned invasion,that of Napoleon.This circular tower,with walls nearly 6ft thick,had a swivel cannon mounted on the roof,and it was defended by 1 officer and 24 men.This was actually the westernmost of these{Martello {Towers,}which were built to cover the Kent and Sussex coastline,and many can still be seen in the neighbouring Eastbourne_Pevensey region.This particular one was finished in 1806 by which time invasion was unlikely as Napoleon's combined French and Spanish fleet had been virtually destroyed by Nelson at the Battle of Trafalgar. It has been used as a cafe,a skating rink and a house.It is now a Museum.
